cmCourseInfo.description: Forest conservation issues in Canada; development of forest management philosophy in Canadian and temperate forest regions; and concepts of sustainability. Techniques for more sustainable forest management: structural retention; forest certification; old growth; value-added and non-traditional forest products. Field trip fee: $20.
cmCourseInfo.title: Conservation of Canada's Forests

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

cmCourseInfo.description: A ten day field course examining urban forestry issues in the GTA, southern and eastern Ontario and Quebec. Topics include: urban forest inventories, nursery production, arboricultural techniques, urban woodland management, urban forest health, urban forest administration, urban dendrology, and urban forestry research. Additional fees of $850 for field course (e.g. accommmodation, food, other within course travel expenses) will apply. See Faculty website for details. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Urban Forest Conservation Field Camp
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FOR200H1, FOR201H1, or permission of the instructor.

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
The 2018 FOR418H1 Urban Forest Conservation Field Camp has been scheduled to run from April 30th to May 11th, 2018. Five days will be spent in the Greater Toronto Area(Mon, April 30- Fri, May 4) and five days travelling in eastern Ontario, Ottawa and Montreal areas (Mon, May 7- Fri, May 11). The cost of the course will be approximately $750-850.00 to cover travel and accommodation expenses along with some of the meals. Students will be expected to cover any remaining meals on their own. For more information contact the Undergraduate Administrator, Laura Lapchinski at laura.lapchinski@utoronto.ca.
